intro: Cybianthus subspicatus, commonly known as the slender cybianthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its narrow, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers make it a distinctive member of its habitat. It is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks in its native range.
